resources.string: Kegel exercises can help make the muscles under the uterus, bladder, and bowel (large intestine) stronger.\n\nThey can help both men and women who have problems with urine leakage or bowel control.

Tense the muscles in your pelvic floor, then relax them. 

Keep other muscles relaxed. Don't contract your abdominal, leg, or buttock muscles, or lift your pelvis. 

Gradually increase the length of contractions and relaxations.
Consult your doctor before starting an exercise
Read more about the Kegel exercise on the website
